description: Discover more of what you need more quickly. Semantic search provides you with   highly relevant search results from continually refreshed and extensive academic content from over 120 million publications.
steps: Subscribe to the Microsoft Text Analytics API on the https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/AcademicSearch
In settings->credential section you will see apiKey (Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key)

blocks.name: getInterpretation
blocks.description: Takes an end user query string (i.e., a query entered by a user of your application) and returns formatted interpretations of user intent based on the Academic Graph data and the Academic Grammar.To provide an interactive experience, you can call this method repeatedly after each character entered by the user. In that case, you should set the complete parameter to 1 to enable auto-complete suggestions. If your application does not want auto-completion, you should set the complete parameter to 0.

args.name: key
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API.

args.name: region
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.Example: westcentralus

args.name: complete
args.info: 1 means that auto-completion suggestions are generated based on the grammar and graph data.

args.name: count
args.info: Maximum number of interpretations to return.

args.name: offset
args.info: Index of the first interpretation to return. For example, count=2&offset=0 returns interpretations 0 and 1. count=2&offset=2 returns interpretations 2 and 3.

args.name: timeout
args.info: Timeout in milliseconds. Only interpretations found before the timeout has elapsed are returned.

args.name: query
args.info: Query entered by user. If complete is set to 1, query will be interpreted as a prefix for generating query auto-completion suggestions.

args.name: model
args.info: Name of the model that you wish to query. Currently, the value defaults to "latest".

blocks.name: getAcademicEntities
blocks.description: Return a set of academic entities based on a query expression.

args.name: key
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API.

args.name: region
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.Example: westcentralus

args.name: expr
args.info: A query expression that specifies which entities should be returned.

args.name: model
args.info: Name of the model that you wish to query. Currently, the value defaults to "latest".

args.name: count
args.info: Number of results to return.

args.name: offset
args.info: Index of the first result to return.

args.name: orderby
args.info: Name of an attribute that is used for sorting the entities. Optionally, ascending/descending can be specified. The format is: name:asc or name:desc.

args.name: attributes
args.info: List that specifies the attribute values that are included in the response. Attribute names are case-sensitive.

blocks.name: calcHistogram
blocks.description: Calculate the distribution of attribute values for a set of paper entities.

args.name: key
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API.

args.name: region
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.Example: westcentralus

args.name: expr
args.info: A query expression that specifies the entities over which to calculate histograms.

args.name: model
args.info: Name of the model that you wish to query. Currently, the value defaults to "latest".

args.name: attributes
args.info: List that specifies the attribute values that are included in the response. Attribute names are case-sensitive.

args.name: count
args.info: Number of results to return.

args.name: offset
args.info: Index of the first result to return.

blocks.name: graphSearch
blocks.description: The graph query interface powered by Graph Engine allows us to not only query entities that meet certain criteria (e.g. find a paper with a given title), but also perform pattern matching via graph exploration (e.g. detect co-authorship).

args.name: key
args.info: Subscription key which provides access to this API.

args.name: region
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.Example: westcentralus

args.name: mode
args.info: Request type of query. Should be "json" or "lambda"

args.name: body
args.info: Query object
